column1: Every day we are one step closer to a vaccine to deal a crushing blow to COVID-19.    What will America look like after the virus?    Under #BidenHarris2020 we get:   ➡️ Higher taxes more spending and stifling regulations – all are wet blankets on a recovering economy.
@realDonaldTrump Time to come together to help America deal with COVID as we move toward a vaccine.

@realDonaldTrump I very much appreciate all the medical personnel who are taking care of our President and all Americans battling COVID.  Finally it appears drug therapies are making a real difference regarding COVID outcomes.    Better days ahead.
After being informed of his positive test and out of an abundance of caution I was tested for COVID-19 in South Carolina.    I was informed I was negative.

Like millions of Americans I'm wishing @realDonaldTrump  and @FLOTUS well regarding their COVID-19 infections. @SenMikeLee informed me today that he expects to be back at the @senjudiciary fully engaged by Oct. 12. I talked to Mike today - he's in good spirits and on the mend.

Today we passed a very sad milestone of 200000 coronavirus-related deaths.   My prayers are with all the families impacted by this virus — and I remain determined to see an effective vaccine is available soon.  https://t.co/ykGAqHoE9H

▶️Rebuilt our military.  ▶️ Withdrew from the Iran nuclear deal.  ▶️ Replaced NAFTA with USMCA.  ▶️ Placed travel ban on China at the start of COVID-19 pandemic.  ▶️ Recognized Jerusalem as capital of Israel.  ▶️ Destroyed the ISIS Caliphate.
Coronavirus has been a wakeup call for America.     We must break our dependency on China and bring the production of critical medical supplies back to the United States!   https://t.co/TsBruomXVh

What have we learned from coronavirus?   90% of the PPE our doctors nurses and healthcare workers use to keep us safe is made in China.   I have legislation to bring the PPE supply chain back to the United States.  VIA @foxcarolinanews:   https://t.co/AIKl01xXPa

Coronavirus has been a painful wake-up call that we are too reliant on nations like China for critical medical supplies. The Chinese grip on this critical supply chain MUST end -- and the U.S. MADE Act is a step in that direction. https://t.co/SbNvQbDBTJ

Great dinner last night with President @realDonaldTrump Secretary Mnuchin and White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows.  We discussed stimulus package to continue the momentum of our economic recovery and how best to fight coronavirus.

This is really good news.    It means America is coming back economically people are going back to work.   There is confidence you can actually open up the country.    But coronavirus could be a wet blanket on a growing economy if we don’t control it.   https://t.co/NBI3qXCUXp
Like all Americans I want to recreate the strong economy we had before coronavirus. The policies which created that economy should be utilized today.

Before coronavirus legal immigration and programs like these played an important role in helping President Trump create the strongest economy in generations. I have little doubt that programs like these would help him build it again.
Wishing @RepTomRice his wife Wrenzie and son Lucas a speedy recovery from COVID19. A great family doing a great job for South Carolina.

Our nation has been hit hard by the #coronavirus and today we passed a sad milestone of 100000 deaths.    I’m convinced that if we had not engaged in aggressive mitigation practices the number would be much greater.    https://t.co/73cEVB7O4D

It is time to pass my legislation imposing sanctions on China for refusing to cooperate with the international community regarding the origins of #COVID19 failing to close their wet markets and for their efforts to destroy Hong Kong.
The Pelosi package will never see the light of day in the Senate.    In the Senate we will work with the Trump Administration to jump start the economy and fund efforts to defeat COVID19.
It has so much unrelated to coronavirus — it is Dead on Arrival in the Senate. https://t.co/q4Xw3PfqJD

Great to hear @RepDougCollins is introducing my China sanctions bill in the House of Representatives.  Doug is off and running in the House to make China cooperate regarding the coronavirus.    https://t.co/JIqpOEOOMa

Great questions from our recent Online Town Hall!   YES we're moving forward with judicial appointments. 🏛  NO illegals aren't eligible for stimulus checks. 💵  NO America's supply chain shouldn't rely on China. 🩺  YES I'm pretty sure E.T. can contract #COVID19. 👽 https://t.co/43IYDcTm2i

If it were not for the irresponsible behavior of the Chinese communist party there would be no #COVID19Pandemic    Thousands of Americans would still be alive and 22 million Americans would still be working at their jobs.  China is responsible. It is time to hold them to account.

Until WHO changes its behavior and leadership I think it’s in America’s best interest to withhold funding. They’ve been deceptive they’ve been slow they’ve been Chinese apologists — and they've failed miserably when it comes to #COVID19. https://t.co/8Ifb6ohOVF
When it comes to the month of February most Democrats and the media were more worried about impeaching President @realDonaldTrump than coronavirus.    https://t.co/dCCWIWMFDu

➡️Also remember Democrats were pushing hard to extend impeachment in early February by calling additional witnesses to the Senate trial.   Clearly Democrats were not concerned about #COVID19 hurting the country when they were pushing an extension the Senate impeachment trial.

I appreciate all the Trump Administration is doing to contain coronavirus and help employers and workers affected by our mitigation policies.    However the unemployment problem in this country is in dire need of focused attention.

As the #COVID19 outbreak continues donations are needed to maintain sufficient blood supply.   Blood centers are taking necessary precautions to ensure your safety.   If you are healthy consider donating blood to ensure availability for those in need.   https://t.co/q7xjmZmrxv

Sens. Cory Booker Lindsey Graham and more than 60 congressional lawmakers urged the World Health Organization on Thursday to ban and permanently close all wet markets globally amid the #CoronavirusPandemic.  https://t.co/uAMzjFOoTP

If it were up to me the whole world would send China a bill for the #CoronavirusPandemic.    This is the third pandemic to come out of China.

We must get enhanced benefits out to millions of Americans who have been laid off due to coronavirus containment. Need ‘Manhattan Project’ approach to modernizing state unemployment systems so checks can flow to help workers.

Just spoke with President @realdonaldTrump.    He’s right to insist that Congress – working together – send him a bill to help American workers doctors and nurses and all who are suffering from the #CoronavirusPandemic NOW.
When it comes to how to fight #CoronavirusPandemic I’m making my decisions based on healthcare professionals like Dr. Fauci and others not political punditry.     https://t.co/ePuWBGd7SD

Thinking of Senators @RandPaul and @amyklobuchar during these times.   Thoughts and prayers for a quick recovery for them and their loved ones battling #coronavirus.    We are all in this together. 🇺🇸🇺🇸🇺🇸

It’s important that the Congress rise to the challenge to help millions of Americans suffering.    We must also keep our critical infrastructure in place until we turn the corner on coronavirus.    I know our international competitors certainly will.
In the Senate we are working on a package to offer economic assistance to millions of Americans who have been put out of work due to #CoronavirusPandemic.
Attacking coronavirus  STARVE IT: Social distancing slow human transmission.  BOMB IT: Better therapies knock the lethality down.  KILL IT: Vaccine to end it once and for all.
📺📌📺📌📺  Speaking with @seanhannity in just a few minutes about the latest on congressional response to coronavirus.  https://t.co/AvM9igSlIK
In the War Against Coronavirus ALL of us are key players.    We are ALL soldiers in the fight!
I'll be speaking with @TeamCavuto today at 4:00 pm on Fox News about the latest on #COVID19.

The federal government needs to be working with the states and private sector to protect the income of those who — through no fault of their own — are unable to work due to these coronavirus containment policies.
Containing and limiting the spread of coronavirus is going to require a massive lockdown of our economy.

I want to thank our healthcare workers who are devoting countless hours to combating #coronavirus.   God bless them all for the risks they take and all the hard work they do to keep us safe and healthy.   They are all heroes! https://t.co/byXZgD8JRR

I was just informed by Dr. Moynihan the head of the House Physicians Office that my coronavirus test was NEGATIVE.  I’m very grateful and like everyone else will follow the best practices to stay negative.

Truly appreciate the care package from @FLOTUS Melania Trump and President @realDonaldTrump.  Can’t wait to get back to work with the President and my Senate colleagues to contain coronavirus and stabilize the economy.    We will get through this together! 🇺🇸 🇺🇸 🇺🇸 https://t.co/eFUFWBG8iZ

President Trump’s decision to declare a national emergency over the #coronavirus pandemic is the right call.    It will free up much needed resources and allow for a more flexible and aggressive response.

President @realDonaldTrump laid out a very good roadmap to achieve economic stability and contain the spread of #coronavirus.  I hope Congress will work with him in a constructive fashion to achieve these goals.

Secretary Pompeo is doing a great job working with the international community regarding the #WuhanVirus / (coronavirus) by ensuring our coordination with allies and effected nations throughout the world.
